Argentina: The Portuguese established a trading post across the Rio de la Plata from Buenos Aires
Barbados: White labourers mostly leave, to Carolinas, (Charleston, South Carolina); and to other West Indian islands, especially Jamaica.
Bhutan: Bhutan invades Sikkim. The same year, Ngawang Namgyal's son is succeeded by the Zhabdrung's stepbrother.
Chile: Bartholomew Sharp destroys and pillages La Serena.
India: Shivaji dies of fever at Raigad.
Sambhaji becomes 2nd Chhatrapati of the Maratha Empire
Japan: Ietsuna died and was succeeded by his younger brother, Tokugawa Tsunayoshi.
Philippine: University of Santo Tomas placed under Royal Patronage by King Charles II of Spain.
Russia: Russo-Crimean Wars: The Crimean invasions of Muscovy ended.
Sweden: The city of Karlskrona is founded.
The Great Reduction of 1680 is enacted, returning to the Swedish Crown lands that had earlier been granted to the nobility.
USA: Pueblo Revolt: A revolt took place in Spanish New Mexico.
